findings.title: Project contains vulnerable dependencies
findings.description: The system under audit uses crates with Rust Security (RustSec) advisories and crates that are no longer maintained.

findings.title: MobileCoin Foundation could infer token IDs in certain scenarios
findings.description: The MobileCoin Foundation is the recipient of all transaction fees and, in certain scenarios, could infer the token ID used in one of multiple transactions included in a block.

findings.title: Token IDs are protected only by SGX
findings.description: Token IDs are intended to be confidential but are operated on within an SGX enclave without additional security mechanisms.

findings.title: Nonces are not stored per token
findings.description: The code does not store nonces per token, instead using a single set to track unique nonces across all tokens.

findings.title: Clients have no option for verifying blockchain configuration
findings.description: Clients have no way to verify whether the MobileCoin node they connect to is using the correct blockchain configuration, exposing users to attacks.

findings.title: Confidential tokens cannot support frequent price swings
findings.description: The method for determining tokens’ minimum fees has limited applicability and cannot support tokens whose prices change frequently.

findings.title: Overflow handling could allow recovery of transaction token ID
findings.description: The current overflow handling mechanism may enable an attacker to recover a transaction's token ID.
